fields.description:
Hi,

I'd like to know if it would be possible to perform a commit to my repository via the bitbucket site, akin to uploading an attachment to gmail for example.

This would be very helpful in situations where someone needs to do a quickfix on a non-dev pc and wants to persist the changes without having to sending it by email or in a flashdrive.

I usually encounter these issues in clients where I can't plug my pc to the network and theirs doesn't have Mercurial (nor permissions to install it, aside from the fact that I usually also don't want my repo in their pc).

Best regards,\\
Bruno

Hello,

I created a repo named TennisOnline that seems to be stucked in the step: Please wait a moment while we create your repository

Thanks in advance,\\
Cédric

The only way to access it is go to the the team's page, and click in through there.

In the attached screenshot "bbmakepop"(the transferred repo), is the repository that should be visible in the right panel, but is not there.

fields.description:
In the detailed commit window, we can not see the diff for a .psd1 file (Message "Binary file modified"), .psd1 are text file : http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd878337%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

This is a very, very minor issue :)

Edit : it seems the problem is in fact with unicode encoding, like describe in BCLOUD-5648

Also, these extensions:\\
.PS1 – Windows PowerShell shell script\\
.PSD1 – Windows PowerShell data file (for Version 2)\\
.PSM1 – Windows PowerShell module file (for Version 2)\\
.PS1XML – Windows PowerShell format and type definitions\\
.CLIXML - Windows PowerShell serialized data\\
.PSC1 – Windows PowerShell console file\\
.PSSC - Windows PowerShell Session Configuration file
fields.summary: Powershell Module Manifest file (.psd1) are detected as binary instead of text. (BB-6714)

fields.description:
Yesterday I did not encounter  this error.  However, this evening when I went to make an adjustment to one of my wiki pages I noticed this:\\
Wiki macro error: 'Wiki' object has no attribute 'get_file_or_404'

The Wiki macro causing the problem is\\
<<toc /1>>

I use this to make a "table of contents" for my wiki so I can navigate between pages on my web browser.  I found this method out on the online documentation when I first began using Bitbucket. I had not changed the page recently that is now giving me problems.\\
If I could know how to fix this problem, or a different way to display links to pages automatically, that would be appreciated.

Thanks

I think you should add some sort of personal status feature for the news feeds. For example, when I open bitbucket, I can say and submit what's on my mind; in addition, I can see what my colleagues are saying and respond to them. I'm sure invoking topics and ideas could be discussed here just like on Facebook. Seriously consider it please, it could expand the overall attraction for team development projects.

# Duplicate does not have link, instead, ugly <<issue 452>> is shown.

I feel like all these errors have common cause.

https://bitbucket.orghttps://bitbucket.org/umonkey/rss/feed

I tried to create my first private repository, but it is more than 45 minutes that I see the message:

Please wait a moment while we create your repository.

I think it's a bug in the creation of the repository.

Hi,\\
I don't know if it's a bug or a deliberate commercial policy, but I thought I'd report since it is annoying.

We have a team account with private repositories and a 10 users limit. The problem is when a team member makes a fork of one of our private repositories, they doesn't inherit the team's 10 users limit; instead, they get the "You're over your plan limit. Committers have read-only access" message over all their pages.

This means that the "fork" feature becomes less useful than it should be, even though we have paid enough for our current team member count.
fields.summary: Team members don't inherit team limits

Allow _forking_ and _pull requests_ between Bitbucket and Stash.

Use cases:

* Company using Stash 'behind the firewall' can open source their chosen projects on Bitbucket.
* Easy backup of hosted Bitbucket repository on premises (if mirroring functionality developed)
* Multiple teams can use different infrastructure. Eg. 'core' internal developers using Stash, outsourced guys on Bitbucket.
* Bitbucket will have the edge over Github!
fields.summary: Bitbucket/Stash repository forking and pull request connector (BB-6686)

fields.description:
The main two reasons I've switched from using GitHub to BitBucket are the more liberal private repository hosting policy and that I could created a nested repository directory structure (or so I thought).  Unfortunately, the "slug" git repository name mapping implemented on BitBucket interferes with my attempts to use a nested repository directory structure.

First some background info.

The Boost C++ libraries project is currently experimenting with converting their Subversion repository to a set of git repositories:  a git repository named boost.git acting as a super-project and separate submodule git repositories for each C++ library and tool in Boost.  The experimental Boost C++ libraries are hosted under github.com/boost-lib.\\
I currently have a local LAN server that has mirror cloned repositories of the official boost-lib repositories on github.com/boost-lib, pulling down the changes as desired.  These mirror cloned repositories are under ~scm/git/oss/tool/boost-lib on the LAN server and are identical to the github.com/boost-lib repositories.  I then again mirror cloned the ~scm/git/oss/tool/boost-lib repositories to reside under ~scm/git/bluezoo/tool/boost-lib, which are shared by my individual local projects .  These ~scm/git/bluezoo/tool/boost-lib mirror cloned repositories are identical to the github.com/boost-lib repositories except they contain a bluezoo/master branch that is identical to the original master branch except for modifications to the .gitmodules file (see attachment).  I modify the .gitmodules file to use a relative path instead of an absolute path to the github.com/boost-lib submodule repositories, e.g. all the url properties in the .gitmodules files are changed from the absolute http://github.com/boost-lib/foo.git to the relative ../foo.git.  This allows me to do a --recurse-submodules push to the LAN server repositories from my local project repositories and a --recurse-submodules pull from the LAN server repositories to my local project repositories.  I'd like to be able to push my LAN server repositories with their nested repository submodule structure to BitBucket, but because of the "slug" mapping my mhcox/bluezoo/tool/boost-lib/boost.git repository is mapped to bluezoo-tool-boost-lib-boost.git.

So can the "slug" mapping algorithm be modified to allow nested repository directory structures?
fields.summary: Allow accounts to have nested repository directory structure

fields.description:
I am running the following command and receiving the same result for start = 0, 1, 2, or 3. When I do start=4 it finally switches to a different result. Please see attachment for detailed output. This only happens when sorting and requesting by offset.

curl -i -u thedillonb:***** "https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/thedillonb/bitbucketbrowser/issues?sort=status&start=0&limit=1"

curl -i -u thedillonb:***** "https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/thedillonb/bitbucketbrowser/issues?sort=status&start=1&limit=1"

curl -i -u thedillonb:***** "https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/thedillonb/bitbucketbrowser/issues?sort=status&start=2&limit=1"

curl -i -u thedillonb:***** "https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/thedillonb/bitbucketbrowser/issues?sort=status&start=3&limit=1"

All four above returns the same issue:

{\\
"count": 26,\\
"filter": {},\\
"search": null,\\
"issues": [\\
{\\
"status": "new",\\
"priority": "trivial",\\
"title": "Good",\\
"reported_by": {\\

fields.summary: REST API: Requesting Issues while sorting provides same result regardless of start offset

fields.description:
It would be nice if the reST processor could parse [{{.. include::}} directives|http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/ref/rst/directives.html#including-an-external-document-fragment]. The use-case is allowing one to factor out a set of links and replacements (I like to keep them in a top-level {{.links.rst}} file) so that one can freely use them in various {{.rst}} files throughout a project without having to redefine them in each file.

(It would actually be nice to be able to include a set of links from the web so that I only have to maintain one set, but this is probably a security problem, which is probably why ReStructuredText does not permit.)

The help documentation refers to a navigation bar on the left side with important functions such as how to change access rights for users in a project.

With the new layout, this functionality is gone; the entire navigation bar just is not there. The issue appears both on SeaMonkey (Firefox derivative) and Safari on Mac OS 10.7.

Is it possible to go back to the old layout which worked well?
fields.summary: Cannot see navigation bar on the left side

fields.description:
Hey Team!

I've found a bug where I get a 404 Error page after switching between branches in the Source view area. Here are the steps that I've taken to recreate the bug;

# View the repo (https://bitbucket.org/ghagivassilis/test-run).
# Select "Source" from the menu.
# From the 'master' branch, switch to another branch ('creative' in my repo) using the branch selection drop-down.
# Open a directory within the new branch ('Creative' in my repo).
# Switch back to the 'master' branch using the branch selection drop-down.
# 404 Error Page.

I hope this helps, if you have any questions or require me to do some further testing please let me know.

George.
fields.summary: View Source, Switch Branch, Broken Link
Wiki TOC doesn't show page titles (BB-6592)

fields.description:
The repo settings include fields for description and a website URL. The description is only shown on the overview page if there's no readme, and the url doesn't seem to be used anywhere at all.

The description should really be in the header (where it was before the facebook redesign), ditto for the website link. The description should also feature in the repo list.

At the bitbucket website, when I choose the Commits pages and press on an specific commit ID, I can see a summary of the added and removed lines.\\
When there are not added lines it shows "+0" and when thre are not removed lines it shows "-0", which is clearly incorrect because zero is unsigned.\\
It seems like a typical case of programming lazyness :)\\
It should be at least "0", but I think it would be even more useful to show nothing.

I've recently been setting up several private repos for my team, most of the private.

After selecting that the repo should be private, I was surprised to see the "don't allow public forks" checkbox deselected by default - I would expect private repos to default to staying private, not becoming public through a fork.

Any chance this could be updated for private repos?
fields.summary: private repos: select "no public forks" by default? (BB-1942)

fields.description:
The new email messages reporting a New Issue have a very short link that unfortunately does not actually point to the actual issue.  The former method was far superior, because people could copy links from the emails, often many of them, into one message they'd forward to somebody else.  Now they don't actually have in the email messages a useful direct link.

Here's an example of a new email message I received. It includes the short link https://bitbucket.org.  The link it should include is the full link to the new issue:  https://bitbucket.org/sealed/truthmarket/issue/268/need-a-simple-way-to-allow-users-to-embed

From: rhayesroth [issues-reply%40bitbucket.org]\\
Date: November 17, 2012 12:24:06 PM PST\\
To: rhayes-roth@truthseal.org\\
Subject: [sealed/truthmarket] Need a simple way to allow users to embed our posters and campaign pages (issue BCLOUD-268)

--- you can reply above this line ---

New issue 268: Need a simple way to allow users to embed our posters and campaign pages\\
https://bitbucket.org

rhayesroth:

The attached file describes a desire to allow users/viewers to embed our posters and a simplified, smaller version of the campaign detail page. First we want to have that code, and a demonstration of how a user employs it to embed the poster and/or the campaign page into their own website.

After we have that, we'll want to consider some design options for adding that type of embedding option with a button on the posters and campaign pages.  I don't have good ideas about that latter issue. Am open to suggestions.

The demonstration of how to do it should be in a simple document we can give to partners so they can understand how to do it simply for their own sites.

--

This is an issue notification from bitbucket.org. You are receiving\\
this either because you are the owner of the issue, or you are\\
following the issue.
fields.summary: New email messages about new issues don't have a link to the actual issue

fields.description:
Hello,

Testing some extreme pull behavior found an incomplete warning message. In a conflict the message says ' ... execute the following commands:' but no command is showed.

Attached capture.

Regards,

Santiago
All other wikis I've show color coded links to indicate if they are broken or not (red if broken, blue if linked).
fields.summary: Links pointing to missing pages should be highlighted (BB-6693)

fields.description:
I've imported a repo from github with a bunch of existing commits, but all committers, including myself, appear as unknown in the commit stream, i.e. not mapped to a bitbucket profile.

# The emails on existing commits are correct: I have added and verified emails that I've used to commit via github to my account, bitbucket still can't map the commits by that email to the actual profile.
# If, after importing the repo, I make a new commit with the same email, the committer is mapped correctly to my profile.

I know I can work around it by adding aliases of all committers manually per repo, but I feel like I should not have to, all the information is already there, and Bitbucket should be able to figure it out.
fields.summary: Users are not mapped in imported git repo

fields.description:
When creating new issue (like https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/new)\\
on tab pressed cusing in "Assignee" it focuse on a bug, and other focus.
I created a patch for some program and I saw that I have a message in my inbox, when I mistakenly clicked on "Send message" it allowed me to do it even if the message was empty.
fields.summary: Empty message is allowed in messages area (BB-6561)

fields.description:
Hi guys,

would be really great to pin on dashboard some of my favorite projects. I have more than 60 of them and it is hard to find needed one.

Hello,

I found a typo in the invitation mail.

You write 'Accept your invitation by visting:' but it should be 'Accept your invitation by visiting:'. You misspelled the word 'visiting', it is missing an 'i'.

Cheers,\\
Philip

###############

h2. Mail content
###############\\
You have been invited by <USERNAME> to become a contributor to >USERNAME>/>REPOSITORY> on bitbucket.org.

Accept your invitation by visting:

 <LINK>This invitation will expire in 30 days.

Cheers,

The Bitbucket Team

Some branches have different build instructions or different annotations in the readme.md files that are critical for users. The main branch's readme is always shown at the bottom of the page when browsing a repo, even on a branch with a different readme.
fields.summary: Different Readme.md files for different branches not automatically shown (BB-6557)

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I stepped into this site and logged in giving my password.\\
Then looked at the address bar to find out it wasn't actually BitBucket.

Could you check out and let me know if it's phishing or something like?\\
Doesn't look just a domain redirect...

http://code.larlet.fr/

Maybe not the right place to post it but please let me know.

I'm trying to create a new private repository called "siem" and it seems to be stuck displaying the line I've put in the issue's title.

Thanks in advance

https://bitbucket.org/omarkhd/siem

(I've seen some other issues like this assigned to Jesper Noehr)
fields.summary: "Please wait a moment while we create your repository"

fields.description:
I created a repo called "International Fence & Railings", the site has been "creating" it for about 5 minutes not. I have created other repos after this one without any problems.

https://bitbucket.org/michaelfillier/international-fence-railings

The RSS for the newsfeed appears to only link to the front page for all entries, not highlighting of what the link was supposed to take me to.

The most recent link on my personal feed is: https://bitbucket.org/#comment-2406446

It used to be a link like this: https://bitbucket.org/durin42/hg-git/issue/59/traceback-on-push-where-auto-packing#comment-2406446

If I'm not logged in the computer I clicked the link for, I'm just directed to the general homepage. And if I am logged in, I just see the dashboard, but what I wanted to see is not highlighted at all.
fields.summary: RSS doesn't link to proper place (BB-6564)

Loving the new design though - looking forward to a github alternative!\\
Steve
